intro: Petiveria tetrandra, commonly known as wild betony, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Amaranthaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture. Petiveria tetrandra is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
